title: Review: British Sea Power – Living Is So Easy
content:
Having recently announced Valhalla Dancehall as the title for their forthcoming album, British Sea Power have generously decided to give away a track from the record, released at the beginning of next year. Living Is So Easy is available to download from the groups Official Site, in exchange for your email address. Much is expected of the Brighton based group, after their most commercially successful album to date, the Mercury Nominated Do You Like Rock Music?.

Living Is So Easy picks up in a similar jovial, folk pop style, it’s almost like an electronically orientated Mumford & Sons, which isn’t anywhere near as horrendous as it sounds. It’s simple yet effective, Yan’s vocals are delivered in his traditional laid-back style, backed up by female vocals from new British Sea Power member Abi Fry. When we caught up with the guys, they told us how they forced themselves into isolation for the recording of Valhalla Dancehall, and the effect of this has seemingly inspired them to produce a more refined sound, although the lyrics at times contain a monumental bleakness only they could master. It’s a welcome return from the guys, and this track is sure to expand their ever growing fan base in the run up to the release of their new record.
